abstract.p: Norman Mintz letter says it is about time that rural colleges and universities realized that students may need some urban amenities and buzz (Feb 7 article)

block.p: It is about time that many colleges and universities realize that students need and want a place where they can relax that is apart from their campus (''Rural Colleges Seek New Edge and Urbanize,'' front page, Feb. 7). Having a vibrant downtown, Main Street or neighborhood commercial district meets that need and serves the school's recruiting process.

It is about time that many colleges and universities realize that students need and want a place where they can relax that is apart from their campus (''Rural Colleges Seek New Edge and Urbanize,'' front page, Feb. 7). Having a vibrant downtown, Main Street or neighborhood commercial district meets that need and serves the school's recruiting process.
For those colleges and universities that do not have such locations, it is an excellent idea to build such areas.
Likewise, it behooves those institutions that are fortunate to have such places to make sure they support the challenge of downtown revitalization. In that way, everyone is a winner.
The writer is a co-author of a book about downtown revitalization.
